Tree | blank1_info_sec1 = Ilex integra | blank2_name_sec1 = - Flower | blank2_info_sec1 = Hamabō (Hibiscus hamabo) | blank3_name_sec1 = | blank3_info_sec1 = | blank4_name_sec1 = | blank4_info_sec1 = | blank5_name_sec1 = | blank5_info_sec1 = | blank6_name_sec1 = | blank6_info_sec1 = | blank7_name_sec1 = | blank7_info_sec1 = | blank_name_sec2 = Phone number | blank_info_sec2 = 088-684-1111 | blank1_name_sec2 = Address | blank1_info_sec2 = 170 Muyachō Minamihama Higashihama, Naruto-shi, Tokushima-ken 772-8501 | website = Naruto City | footnotes = }} is a Japanese city in Tokushima Prefecture on the island of Shikoku.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Naruto Kaikyō" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 700. One of the famous attractions is the Naruto whirlpools between Naruto and Awaji Island in the Seto Inland Sea. Naruto has the home stadium of professional soccer team Tokushima Vortis.Soccerway.com, "Tokushima Vortis"; retrieved 2012-9-21. Ryōzen-ji and Gokuraku-ji are in Naruto. They are the first two temples of the 88 Temple Pilgrimage. ==References== ==Other websites== * Naruto City website * Image of Naruto whirlpool Category:Cities in Tokushima Prefecture
title: Naruto, Tokushima
